title: Index column in `st.data_editor` can not be disabled

labels.name: type:docs

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

While working with `st.data_editor` I noticed some strange behavior regarding the dataframe index: If the index on the dataframe is set explicitly, it automatically is editable. This causes issues further down the road, if the data is addressed using the indices and the user changed them.  
Additionally, I found no way to disable the editing of the index column as is possible using [st.column_config](https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/api-reference/data/st.column_config) for every other column.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import pandas as pd
import streamlit as st

st.write('Table 1 (no index)')
df_no_index = pd.DataFrame(
    data={'A': [1, 2, 3], 'B': [11, 12, 13]}
)
st.data_editor(df_no_index)

st.write('Table 2 (number index)')
df_number_index = pd.DataFrame(
    data={'A': [1, 2, 3], 'B': [11, 12, 13]},
    index=[0, 1, 2],
)
st.data_editor(df_number_index)

st.write('Table 3 (string index)')
df_string_index = pd.DataFrame(
    data={'A': [1, 2, 3], 'B': [11, 12, 13]},
    index=['a', 'b', 'c'],
)
st.data_editor(df_string_index)
```


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open the Reproducible Code Example
2. See, that the index is editable in table 2 / 3

### Expected Behavior

1. I expect the `st.data_editor` to behave consistently whether an index is given or not (compare Table 1 and 2).
2. I would have expected to find a way to disable the index column, preventing editing by the user.

### Current Behavior

There is no way of disabling the editing of dataframe index.

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.38.0
- Python version: 3.11.9
- Operating System: Windows 10 Enterprise, Version 22H2
- Browser: Microsoft Edge, Version 129.0.2792.65


### Additional Information

I wasn't sure if this qualifies as a bug report or is simply a feature request. Anyways, it was easier to write it down using this form.
